subject: Self Care
title: Gratitude and the Brain
description: A quick win: understand Gratitude and the Brain.

hook.text: Brain scans of grateful people show increased activity in the medial prefrontal cortex â€” the area linked to learning and choices.

buildup.text: Gratitude triggers dopamine and serotonin release. These neurotransmitters are the same ones targeted by antidepressants.

discovery.text: The more you practice gratitude, the easier it becomes. Neural pathways strengthen with repetition, creating a gratitude loop.

twist.text: Gratitude literally rewires the brain. After weeks of practice, you start noticing good things automatically without effort.

climax.text: Commit to 21 days of gratitude journaling. By the end, your brain will have built new default pathways toward appreciation.

punchline.text: Gratitude rewires neural pathways. Practice it and it becomes automatic.
